Body: Launch Game Stars Tournament in 3 simple steps!    Dear friends! Many of you have probably thought of launching your own tournament on Game Stars platform. This is why today we will tell you how to do it. Game Stars platform tends to solve eSports market problems. One of these problems is a difficulty of own tournaments organization. It means both financial spendings and physical efforts.  The goal of Game Stars is to provide growth opportunities for beginner and proficient cyber sportsmen.  How to launch your tournament in 3 simple steps?  1) Click on the start!  Any Game Stars platform user can launch own tournament, select its name, date, and other settings.  For example, it’s up to the organizer whether the tournament will be held in accordance with the Olympic or circular system. The organizer also defines the rate of the entrance fee, number of participants, conditions that allow participating in competitions (open/closed tournament for certain people), the way of distributing the winnings, etc.  2) Select entrance fee  All terms of the tournament are registered in a smart-contract issued by the platform. Thanks to the hash conditions can be checked if there is any disagreement between participants.  After that, each participant pays the entrance fee in GST tokens. Each of them can grant different amount. If the number of interested does not reach the required minimum, the smart contract will automatically return entrance fees.  3) ...Get a reward!  At the end of the tournament, the platform records its results in a smart contract that automatically transfers prize money to the winners. At the same time, 3% of the prize fund is credited to Game Stars platform as a service fee.  If players have contributed different amounts of the entrance fee, the distribution of the winnings depends on shares of each participant.  Please note: the tournament can only be launched if there are GST tokens on the balance. It’s another reason to buy tokens right now! Token Sale will last until June 9th. Well, to be honest, I think I spent much more time in this game. I'm 21 years old and my employment allows me to move from anywhere, to do anything I like.  My achievements:  - Rank G (esea) and level 10 Faceit. I have a lot of experience with teams in tournaments and cups on the Internet. - I won several faceit cups, Esl and PvPro cups and gained a lot of experience in the leagues on esea/cevo and others”.  When did you decide to be a professional player?  It all started when I was about 10 years old. I did not have a PC at home, so I went to play in an Internet café. I remember myself playing Warcraft III, I also decided to try myself in CS 1.6 and just fell in love. In those days I had no idea about eSports. When I was growing up, this area was not as huge as it is today. So I played Warcraft III The frozen throne (dota) and lots, lots of CS more than 7-8 years Then the long hours of staying in CS:Go began. I started to spend a lot of time and effort to learn more things about this game. Unexpectedly I got an offer from the team to join their roster. After the start of our cooperation, they said: "You have a lot of potential, friend."  Tell us about the time when you realized that this is more than a game?  I was streaming and fans started showing up. They watched how I play, wrote nice comments, admiring my skill, and asked questions about improving their skills in CS:GO. They inspired me to practice more, and the moment came when I realized that games were more than just fun after work.  Why do gamers retire so early? Is it due to professional burnout or age?  To my opinion, this is due to professional burnout and the pressure they get from everyone (organizers, fans, sponsors and others). Age is not a problem, I guess.  How many hours per day do you spend on training?  It is much less now. I have other work to do while I used to practice CS:GO every day. Now everything depends on my mood and desire. If I'm tired I can spend some CS:GO demos/matches.  Is there a chance for an ordinary player to find sponsorship and reach the highest level?  Usually the player has no chance to find any sponsorship, but they have a good chance to get into the organization/community and start from there. It is a good background for their launching to the top level. I got acquainted with Game Stars project and realized that you solve such kind of problems.  A lot of brands want to get into this area with the growing interest in e-sports. Can they succeed on this platform and become more than just sponsors?  Brands can do much more than act as sponsors. They have the opportunity to influence the eSports. They can create their own teams and idk leagues. Just think about the Nike or Audi League with decent marketing they can have a huge impact on our cyber aren. For example, as a League of Mountain Dew.  What innovations do you want to see in the eSports world in the future? Can the blockchain become the solution to all cyber challenges?  Well, the innovation that I hope to see in the eSports world is the interest of mass media to our tournaments, because people can find information about eSports apart from the Internet. I think all the media (newspapers, radio, television) should promote our ideas and cover the cyber competition. You say blockchain… Well! If blockchain can be the solution to all eSports problems, then it will definitely help eSports, am I right? That’s why, I sincerely hope that Game Stars platform will be able to implement all its plans. Title: [ANN][ICO] GameStars - Help the development of cybersports
Body: Game Stars Tokens: the purposes of the creating and how to buy it    The Game Stars platform can create two types of the tokens: the GST token (Game Stars token), the personal token of a cyberathlete.  The GST token is a universal means of payment used for settlements within the system. Cyberathlete’s Tokens are created individually for each cyberathlete along with him/her personal smart-contract.  The important information about the GST:  1. The primary purpose  of creating GST is a raising funds for further development of the Game Stars platform; 2. Game Stars Token is a means of payment within the platform; 3. GSTs are ERC-20 Standard tokens on the Ethereum platform; 4. Project team's aim is a one-time emission of 500 million GSTs.  Pay attention, please, within the framework of crowdsale, you may purchase GSTs at the lowest fixed prices.  In future after full implementation of the platform GSTs can be purchased only on the  cryptocurrency exchange at the growing market prices.  GSTs will be in demand among participants of the Game Stars platform (cyber athletes, teams, investors, advertisers and etc).  Users will need GST for the following purposes:  1. To create personal smart-contract for each cyberathlete within the framework CICO; 2. To buy the personal tokens of a cyberathlete on the CICO stage; 3. For formation of the prize money fund for a sponsorship tournament; 4. For tournament participation fee; 5. For repayment of the cyberathlete’s revenue if received in other currencies.  Follow the Game Stars news, see  https://gamestars.io
